  • Method Details

    • init

      public static void init(BNO055IMU imu, DcMotorEx fr, DcMotorEx fl, DcMotorEx br, DcMotorEx bl, DcMotorEx oph, DcMotorEx opv)
      initializes class asuming no wheels should be reversed
      Parameters:
      imu - internal measurement unit
      fr - front right wheel
      fl - front left wheel
      br - back right wheel
      bl - back left wheel
      oph - horizontal dead wheel
      opv - horizontal vertical wheel

    • init

      public static void init(BNO055IMU imu, DcMotorEx fr, DcMotorEx fl, DcMotorEx br, DcMotorEx bl, DcMotorEx oph, DcMotorEx opv, boolean frRev, boolean flRev, boolean brRev, boolean blRev)
      initializes class letting you control which wheels are reversed
      Parameters:
      imu - internal measurement unit
      fr - front right wheel
      fl - front left wheel
      br - back right wheel
      bl - back left wheel
      oph - horizontal dead wheel
      opv - horizontal vertical wheel
      frRev - boolean, describe if front right motor is reversed or not
      flRev - boolean, describe if front left motor is reversed or not
      brRev - boolean, describe if back right motor is reversed or not
      blRev - boolean, describe if back left motor is reversed or not

    • moveToPos

      public static boolean moveToPos(double targetPosX, double targetPosY, double iterationTime)
      moves to a predefined position
      Parameters:
      targetPosX - the target x position you want to robot to move to
      targetPosY - the target y position you want the robot to move to
      iterationTime - the time between each time this function is called. Have to use a timer in main code this is being used in. Used to make PID more accurate.
      Returns:
      returns a boolean that is true if the current position is less than 10 away from the target position

    • turnToAngle

      public static boolean turnToAngle(double targetAngle, double iterationTime)
      This function moves the robot closer to a target angle from its current angle each time it is called.
      Parameters:
      targetAngle - the angle the robot should be facing
      iterationTime - the time between each time this function is called. Used for PID
      Returns:
      returns a boolean that is true of the currentanle is within a set tolerance of the target angle

    • updatePos

      public static void updatePos()
      Updates the position of the robot. Uses all 4 motor encoders to do this. Finds the delta of encoder value of the motors and turns this into a vector. Adds these vectors together to find the change in the robots position. Adds this change to the current position to find the updated current position of the robot.

    • updateDeadWheelPos

      public static double[] updateDeadWheelPos()
      same as update pos but uses deadwheel encoder values instead.
      Returns:
      returns current position of dead wheels for TESTING purposes. Return can be gotton rid of after.

    • distanceFromPos

      public static double distanceFromPos(double targetPosX, double targetPosY)
      returns the distance the current pos is from the target pos
      Parameters:
      targetPosX - the x target position
      targetPosY - the y target position
      Returns:
      returns the distance the currentposition is from the target position

    • getPos

      public static double[] getPos()
      getter for position
      Returns:
      returns the current x and y position as array

    • setMovementTolerance

      public static void setMovementTolerance(double t)
      sets tolerance movement that gets used in the robot movement function to determine wheter to return true of not
      Parameters:
      t - tolerance you want for distance from currentPosition to targetPosition. (How precise the movement has to be to a position)

    • setAngleTolerance

      public static void setAngleTolerance(double t)
      controls the tolerance of whether the turnToAngle returns true. True means it should stop
      Parameters:
      t - tolerance of how close robot should get to angle in turnToAngle function

    • setMovementPID

      public static void setMovementPID(double kp, double kd, double ki)
      This controls the Kp, Kd, and Ki values of the PID for the movement of the robot. This control the the curve of how it approaches a target position.
      Parameters:
      kp - Increasing this makes the robot move to the target position in a more proportional matter. It will move faster when further from the target position and slower when closer
      kd - This makes the robot slow down if it reaches the targetPosition to quickly by adding a negative force.
      ki - This makes the robot speed up if it does not move to the targetPosition quick enough

    • setAnglePID

      public static void setAnglePID(double Kp, double Kd, double Ki)
      This controls the Kp, Kd, and Ki values of the PID for the movement of angle turning of the robot. This control the the curve of how it turns to a target angle
      Parameters:
      Kp - Increasing this makes the robot move to the target angle in a more proportional matter. It will move faster when further from the target angle and slower when closer
      Kd - This makes the robot slow down if it reaches the target angle to quickly by adding a force in the opposite direction.
      Ki - This makes the robot speed up if it does not move to the target angle quick enough
